p: IAAPs can deeply alter the functioning of ecosystems. Ribaudo etÂ al. stressed the biogeochemistry implications of E. densa and Lagarosiphon major, as they are capable to trigger huge stratification events for several key chemical parameters (O 2, C, N), as recurrent hypoxia events. They confirmed that the spread of IAAPs involved a change in the metabolism of ecosystems, resulting in a net nutrient release towards the water column, concurrently with a net increase in carbon emission towards the atmosphere.
